alert.note: Alert for Albany (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and overflow of the Pioneer Canal is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of Albany County, Wyoming in between the Pioneer Canal and the Laramie River along WY230 on the west side of the city of Laramie. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM MDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in Laramie Mobile Home Park along WY230 due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in Laramie Mobile Home Park along WY230 . - Laramie Mobile Home Park along WY230 is experiencing minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Laramie. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
